abstract.p: Jandon Foundation announces 12 recipients of new college scholarship program which recognizes academic achievement of low-income high school students from Westchester County, NY; list (S)

block.p: A new college scholarship program, which recognizes academic achievement among low-income high school students, has named 12 students from Westchester public high schools as its first recipients. Each will receive $10,000 over four years to help pay for college.

The program is financed by the Jandon Foundation, a private family foundation started by Jane and Donald Cecil of Harrison. The County Department of Social Services identified potential recipients among families living below the poverty level. An academic panel then considered the students' grades, Scholastic Achievement Test scores and character in making its selections.

The recipients are Jennifer Marie Acompora, Rye Neck High School; Kendall Boone, Saunders Trade and Technical High School; Neelam Gidwaney, Dobbs Ferry High School; Kelly Marie Jones, Peekskill High School; Scott T. Mikos, Saunders Trade and Technical High School; Deyci Rodriguez, Sleepy Hollow High School; Kathleen Ruperto, Charles Gorton High School; Richard Thomas, Mount Vernon High School; Juan Torres, Croton-Harmon High School; Rita Torres, Charles Gorton High School; Lavoisier A. Tubman, Lincoln High School; and Valerie Wilson, Ossining High School.
